items.title: Commander Keen
items.description: All episodes, but my preference would be in this order: 3, 2, 6, 1, 5, 4. (Keen Dreams sucked big time!)

items.title: Warcraft 2
items.description: So. Many. Hours. Against the CPU. Against my dad. Against my friends. Plain fantastic game!

items.title: Golden Eye 64
items.description: Four-player-split-screen-james-bond-themed-3d-shooter. What more is there to add!?

items.title: World of Warcraft
items.description: The sheer number of hours of gaming pleasure with this title makes it a must for the top 10. Favorite expansion would be Wrath of the Lich King, mostly because that's when most of my real life friends also played the game (I've played Burning Legion through Cataclysm).

items.title: Zelda: Ocarina of Time
items.description: There's something intrinsically great about this game that requires me to place it in a top 10.

items.title: Dota 2
items.description: With over 1700 hours played to date it's hard to deny that I've enjoyed this game. A lot.

items.title: Tetris
items.description: Dragged me through some long trips that would've otherwise been quite tedious. And I'd still happily play it today.

items.title: Warcraft 3
items.description: Great gameplay, great story!

items.title: Prince of Persia
items.description: I still have dreams and nightmares about this game.

items.title: Impossible Mission
items.description: The first Amiga title on this list. Spending weekends at my uncle's place just playing these games: amazing!

items.title: Neverwinter Nights 1
items.description: A very good game, but it's on this list because I had some awesome full-weekend complete co-op playthroughs that were fantastic.

items.title: Menace
items.description: R-Type clone I absolutely loved.

items.title: Wolfenstein 3D
items.description: Didn't even play this game that much, if it weren't for playing the home brew levels my friends made for each other.

items.title: Hollow Knight
items.description: Played only recently, but gameplay was brilliant.

items.title: Heroes of the Storm
items.description: Quit the game multiple times because it was too addictive, so it deserves its spot.

items.title: GTA: San Andreas
items.description: Really got me into the sandbox genre.

items.title: Klax
items.description: Tetris on steroids!

items.title: Super Mario Galaxy
items.description: The gameplay of this game was just phenomenal.

items.title: Whacky Wheels
items.description: Yes, I enjoyed this more than original Mario Kart. Bite me!

items.title: Duke Nukem 3D
items.description: Hail to the king, baby! First co-op 3D shooter with amazing level design.

items.title: Need for Speed â€“ Hot Pursuit
